title: Merging Website Edits Into GPU Branch
Fix nextjs build errors
body: Fix website build errors by removing edge runtime from OG image routes and updating MDX link syntax. The build was failing due to two main issues: incompatibility between `runtime = 'edge'` and `dynamic = 'force-static'` on OpenGraph image generation pages, and `next-mdx-remote` failing to compile MDX content that used angle-bracket autolinks. Removing the `runtime = 'edge'` export and converting angle-bracket links to standard Markdown links resolves these errors. ---

title: Add v1 LSP and VSCode Extension
fixing clippy and cargo push errors
body:
This PR fixes our release publishing pipeline and a clippy issue. 

In `.github/workflows/release.yml` we now publish from the tagged commit (removed checkout to `main`), made the version bump step fail on error, added a dry-run preflight that errors when nothing would be published, and set `GIT_SSL_CAINFO` to remove misleading CA noise—preventing false-green “no-op” releases. 

Separately, in `crates/runmat-gc/src/lib.rs` we resolved a clippy warning by replacing `% 32 == 0` with `is_multiple_of(32)` in the GC allocation heuristic. 

Ran `cargo fmt`, `clippy`, `check`, and tests across the workspace; all passed locally.

title: Adding image to matlab alternatives article
Update builtins docs meta descriptions
body: Set meta description for `/docs/reference/builtins/*` pages to follow the 'Runmat Matlab Runtime builtin function {H1}' pattern to improve SEO. ---

title: Adding ZMQ Transport for Jupyter Kernel
body:
This adds a Jupyter v5 ZMQ transport (HMAC framing) and refactors the kernel to a thread-per-socket server with a persistent ZMQ context. It implements shell/control/stdin/heartbeat/IOPub loops and adds headless ZMQ tests for kernel_info and execute (incl. IOPub status/result). 

Note: some of the message frames; e.g., HistoryRequest/Inspect/Complete are not implemented yet.

Release notes

Sourced from mermaid's releases.

mermaid@11.10.0

Minor Changes

  • #6744 daf8d8d Thanks @​SpecularAura! - feat: Added support for per link curve styling in flowchart diagram using edge ids

Patch Changes

  • #6857 b9ef683 Thanks @​knsv! - feat: Exposing elk configuration forceNodeModelOrder and considerModelOrder to the mermaid configuration

  • #6653 2c0931d Thanks @​darshanr0107! - chore: Remove the "-beta" suffix from the XYChart, Block, Sankey diagrams to reflect their stable status

  • #6683 33e08da Thanks @​darshanr0107! - fix: Position the edge label in state diagram correctly relative to the edge

  • #6693 814b68b Thanks @​darshanr0107! - fix: Apply correct dateFormat in Gantt chart to show only day when specified

  • #6734 fce7cab Thanks @​darshanr0107! - fix: handle exclude dates properly in Gantt charts when using dateFormat: 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss'

  • #6733 fc07f0d Thanks @​omkarht! - fix: fixed connection gaps in flowchart for roundedRect, stadium and diamond shape

  • #6876 12e01bd Thanks @​sidharthv96! - fix: sanitize icon labels and icon SVGs

    Resolves CVE-2025-54880 reported by @​fourcube

  • #6801 01aaef3 Thanks @​sidharthv96! - fix: Update casing of ID in requirement diagram

  • #6796 c36cd05 Thanks @​HashanCP! - fix: Make flowchart elk detector regex match less greedy

  • #6702 8bb29fc Thanks @​qraqras! - fix(block): overflowing blocks no longer affect later lines

    This may change the layout of block diagrams that have overflowing lines (i.e. block diagrams that use up more columns that the columns specifier).

  • #6717 71b04f9 Thanks @​darshanr0107! - fix: log warning for blocks exceeding column width

    This update adds a validation check that logs a warning message when a block's width exceeds the defined column layout.

  • #6820 c99bce6 Thanks @​kriss-u! - fix: Add escaped class literal name on namespace

  • #6332 6cc1926 Thanks @​ajuckel! - fix: Allow equals sign in sequenceDiagram labels

  • #6651 9da6fb3 Thanks @​darshanr0107! - Add validation for negative values in pie charts:

    Prevents crashes during parsing by validating values post-parsing.

    Provides clearer, user-friendly error messages for invalid negative inputs.

  • #6803 e48b0ba Thanks @​omkarht! - chore: migrate to class-based ArchitectureDB implementation

  • #6838 4d62d59 Thanks @​saurabhg772244! - fix: node border style for handdrawn shapes

... (truncated)

title: Implementing remaining language grammar and semantics
body:
## Summary

This PR lands a major language-semantics milestone: full N‑D indexing/slice assignment with `end` arithmetic and broadcasting, robust comma‑list expansion (cells and function returns), core OOP/class semantics with access enforcement and dependent properties, hardened import/name resolution, normalized MATLAB-style error identifiers, string/char array semantics, GC rooting and write barriers, and initial Accelerate scaffolding. All tests across the workspace are green. This advances our long-term goal of 100% MATLAB grammar/semantics with a PyTorch‑like Accelerate backend and maintains a production-grade quality bar with thorough tests.

### Highlights

- N‑D indexing/slicing (read/write) with `end` arithmetic, logical masks, broadcasting
- Comma‑list expansion and propagation (cells `C{...}`, `C{:}`, function returns) and multi‑assign with `~`
- OOP/class: constructors, static/instance property/method access with Access enforcement, dependent properties, overloaded indexing via `subsref`/`subsasgn`
- Parser/HIR: hardened command‑form parsing, class attributes carried and validated, import collection/normalization, flow‑sensitive and inter‑procedural type inference
- Interpreter: comprehensive bytecode coverage, function‑return propagation, globals/persistents, try/catch/rethrow
- Error model: normalized `mex(identifier, message)` across VM/runtime
- Strings/Chars: `StringArray` and `CharArray` semantics with conversions and comparisons
- GC: interpreter roots, write barriers, and generation scaffolding; stress tests added
- Accelerate: API/provider scaffold, `gpuArray`/`gather`, device dispatch hooks for elementwise and `mtimes`
- `cat` variadic reduction moved into runtime builtin (VM shim removed)
- Broad test expansion; all suites green

## Changes by area

### Lexer and Parser
- Tightened command‑form detection; ambiguity rejections; fuzz seeds around adjacency, ellipsis, and metaclass.
- Parsed `classdef` with attributes; dynamic member `s.(expr)`; `?Class` metaclass including postfix forms (`?Class.prop`, `?Class.method(...)`).
- Multi‑assign `[a,~,c]=...` handled; `varargin`/`varargout` placement validated.
- New string literal paths: double‑quoted `StringArray` vs single‑quoted `CharArray`.

### HIR (lowering, validation, types)
- AST→HIR lowering for all constructs including `AssignLValue`, imports, globals/persistents, class blocks; attributes attached to `HirClassMember`.
- Import normalization and ambiguity checks; compile‑time errors for conflicting specifics.
- OOP validation: duplicate/conflict checks; attributes enforcement (Access, GetAccess/SetAccess conflicts; `Static+Dependent`/`Constant+Dependent`; `Abstract+Sealed` methods).
- Flow‑sensitive inference across bodies and control flow; inter‑procedural return summaries; struct‑field refinement via `isfield`/`fieldnames`/`strcmp*`.
- Types: hard cutover to `Type::Tensor` (shape/rank aware) plus `String`, `StringArray`, `CharArray`, `Struct`, `Function`, `GpuTensor`.

### Compiler and Interpreter (Ignition)
- Bytecode coverage for:
  - Indexing/slicing/assignment: `IndexSlice`, `StoreSlice`, `IndexRangeEnd`, logical masks (read/write), 1‑D fast paths
  - Comma‑list expansion and function‑return propagation: `Call*Expand*`, `IndexCellExpand`, `Call*Multi`
  - OOP: `Load/StoreMember`, `LoadStaticProperty`, `CallStaticMethod`, constructor dispatch; metaclass postfix routing
  - Control flow/logicals and exceptions: `AndAnd`, `OrOr`, `EnterTry`, `PopTry`, `Swap`
  - Imports: `RegisterImport`, compile‑time resolution precedence reflected at codegen
- Name resolution precedence: locals > user functions > specific imports > wildcard imports (functions and `Class.*` statics).
- Globals/persistents semantics and VM state persisted across calls.
- Exceptions unified via `mex(...)`; `rethrow` surfaces `MException` correctly.

### Runtime (builtins)
- Arrays/ND ops: `cat` (variadic, now runtime-only), `permute`, `squeeze`, `repmat`, `diag`, `triu`, `tril`, `zeros/ones`, `reshape`.
- Reductions: `sum`, `prod`, `mean`, `any`, `all`, `max/min` (vector and dim-aware multi-returns).
- Indexing helpers: `size`, `length`, `ndims`, `numel`, `ind2sub`, `sub2ind`, `find` (with 2‑D triple return path).
- OOP helpers and test classes: property/method lookup with access enforcement; dependent properties (`get.<prop>`/`set.<prop>`).
- Strings/Chars: conversions (`strings`, `string`, `cellstr`, `char`), concatenation and comparisons across `String/StringArray/CharArray`.
- Import helpers and dynamic `call_method` used by object dispatch.
- Error IDs/messages normalized to MATLAB‑style identifiers.

### Strings and Char arrays
- Double‑quoted `StringArray` vs single‑quoted `CharArray` semantics throughout parsing, HIR, VM, and runtime.
- Scalar selection from `StringArray` returns scalar `String`; `eq`/`ne` across string/char combinations align with MATLAB.

### GC
- Interpreter roots active VM stacks, locals, globals/persistents; write barriers on VM write sites (cells, struct/object fields).
- Young‑gen accounting and collection behaviors improved.
- Stress tests for nested cells, large tensors, exceptions, and high‑churn execution.

### Accelerate (GPU)
- `runmat-accelerate-api`: provider trait, `GpuTensorHandle`, host views; global provider registry.
- `gpuArray`/`gather` wired; basic provider path for elementwise ops and `mtimes` when both operands reside on GPU, with CPU fallback.
- `runmat-accelerate` scaffolding plus a simple in‑process provider to exercise paths; `wgpu` backend stubs present.

### REPL and JIT
- REPL: semicolon suppression; improved type info printing distinguishing `StringArray` vs `CharArray`.
- JIT (Turbine): defers unsupported opcodes to interpreter; recognizes new bytecodes; keeps stable fallback.

### Docs
- Updated architectural docs and READMEs to reflect Tensor‑first design, error model, import precedence, OOP semantics, string/char distinctions, and Accelerate roadmap.

## Error model

- Replaced ad‑hoc errors with canonical `mex` identifiers across VM/runtime:
  - Indexing/slicing: `MATLAB:IndexOutOfBounds`, `MATLAB:IndexStepZero`, `MATLAB:SliceNonTensor`, `MATLAB:AssignShape`, `MATLAB:AssignRank`, `MATLAB:AssignType`, `MATLAB:UnsupportedIndexType`
  - Cells: `MATLAB:CellIndexOutOfBounds`, `MATLAB:CellSubscriptOutOfBounds`, `MATLAB:CellIndexType`, `MATLAB:CellIndexArity`, `MATLAB:CellIndexNonCell`, `MATLAB:CellExpandNonCell`
  - Stack: `MATLAB:StackUnderflow`
  - Resolution: `MATLAB:UndefinedFunction`, `MATLAB:UndefinedVariable`
- Ensures consistent identifiers/messages and uniform surfacing through `MException`.

## Tests

- Parser: command‑form ambiguities, metaclass postfix, lvalues, classdef attributes; fuzz seeds added.
- HIR: attributes round‑trip, class validation (Access, Static, Dependent), import normalization, flow‑sensitive and inter‑procedural inference.
- Interpreter: functions, closures, exceptions, globals/persistents, OOP dispatch, overloaded indexing, comma‑list expansion (cells, vector indices, `C{:}`), nested propagation of function returns, short‑circuit logicals.
- Runtime: indexing helpers, ND ops, reductions, `find` triple returns, strings/chars, OOP helper coverage.
- GC: allocation/collection stress and barrier correctness.
- GPU: `gpuArray`/`gather`, elementwise/`mtimes` device paths compared against CPU.
- All suites green via workspace `cargo test`.

## Performance notes

- 1–2D slice/indexing fast paths restored; broadcasting/scatter paths reduced copying in common cases.
- Expansion paths allocate fewer intermediates; opportunities remain for small‑vec optimizations and fusion (not blocking).

## Breaking changes and migration

- Matrix→Tensor migration is complete; `Matrix` is retired in favor of shape‑aware `Tensor`. Consumers should rely on `size/ndims/numel/length` and ND semantics.
- `cat` variadic reduction is now fully handled in the runtime builtin (no VM shim).
- String/char distinctions: double‑quoted `StringArray` vs single‑quoted `CharArray` are enforced; equality/concatenation follow MATLAB rules.

No user‑facing CLI changes; REPL type‑info improved.

## Review notes

- Suggested order:
  1) `crates/runmat-ignition` bytecode/VM and tests
  2) `crates/runmat-parser` + `crates/runmat-hir` lowering/validation/inference and tests
  3) `crates/runmat-runtime` builtins and string/char semantics
  4) `crates/runmat-gc` rooting/barriers and stress tests
  5) `crates/runmat-accelerate(-api)` provider scaffolding and usage
  6) Docs updates

## Checklist

- [x] All crates build and tests pass locally
- [x] Error identifiers normalized and documented
- [x] Import precedence and ambiguity tests included
- [x] OOP access/attributes enforced and tested
- [x] String/char semantics covered and tested
- [x] GC roots/barriers verified under stress
- [x] `gpuArray`/`gather` + basic provider path validated
- [x] Docs updated

## Future work (post‑merge)

- Complete string API and options; sorting/sets/statistics; complex/sparse types
- Accelerate: strides/dtypes, memory pools/streams, kernels, operator registry, fusion, multi‑GPU, autograd
- JIT: targeted kernels for indexing/elementwise/BLAS once semantics remain stable

This PR establishes a solid, well‑tested baseline for MATLAB‑compatible semantics and prepares the stack for GPU acceleration and further builtin coverage.
